text.p: These are the leading stories in the Egyptian press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- Mubarak, Arafat discussions dealt with contacts underway to save the peace process. Foreign Minister Moussa said after talks that Egypt is working towards positive atmosphere from which negotiations can restart. Presidential adviser Osama el-Baz in Washington today for talks with Dennis Ross.
- Prime Minister Ganzouri says in Kuala Lumpur that Egypt and Malaysia will sign three economic agreements.
- Egypt bids farewell with love to Mostafa Amin.
- Somali leader asked for Egypt's help when he met President Mubarak.
- Mubarak to tell members of local councils today that they must combat unemployment and encourage investment.
- Head of customs agency says that tariffs on cars expected to be reduced in September.
- Interior minister says will boost security to protect citizens over Eid holiday period.
- Customs agency studies reduction of tariffs on imported goods.
- Oil minister appoints new heads for state oil companies and forms committee to develop Egyptian General Petroleum Company.
